definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: This novel criticizes the peasants' uprising and sing the praises of the reactionary rulers.
sentences.chinese: 這本小說批判農民起義，但對反動統治者歌功頌德。

sentences.english: Gone are the days of Mao when peasant uprisings could collectively capture the nation.
sentences.chinese: 在農民起義共同奪取國家政權之後，毛時代就在消亡。

sentences.english: History, outbreaks of several anti-exploitation of the peasant uprising against oppression.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上曾暴發過多次反剝削反壓迫的農民起義。

sentences.english: Another legend says that the practice of hanging red lanterns has something to do with Huang Chao, leader of a peasant uprising.
sentences.chinese: 還有人說，正月十五掛紅燈和農民起義領袖黃巢有關。

sentences.english: Frequent burst of peasant uprisings showed that the dynasties' days were numbered.
sentences.chinese: 農民起義頻頻爆發，表明這個朝代的大數已盡。

sentences.english: The peasants were constrained by the harsh laws of the Qin Dynasty and staged an uprising.
sentences.chinese: 在秦朝的苛法逼迫下，終於發生了農民起義。

sentences.english: Sympathizing with the peasant uprisings, he praised the peasant leaders.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他同情農民起義，所以他讚揚農民領袖。

sentences.english: But when hunger is stronger than the fear of being shot, peasant revolts take place.
sentences.chinese: 但當飢餓超過槍殺的恐懼時，農民起義便發生了。

sentences.english: The Government of the Qing Dynasty collaborated with foreign reactionary forces to crush down the peasant uprising of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 清朝政府勾結外國反動勢力鎮壓太平天國農民起義。

sentences.english: Ming and Qing Dynasties, many times here in the peasant uprising , against feudal rule.
sentences.chinese: 明清時期，這裏發生多次農民起義，反抗封建統治。

sentences.english: Mencius' is the theoretical forefather of the various peasant uprisings in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 孟子是中國曆代農民起義戰爭的理論始祖。

sentences.english: This was the beginning of China's first great peasant uprising .
sentences.chinese: 中國歷史上第一次大規模的農民起義在大澤鄉爆發了。

sentences.english: The peasants staged an uprising against the corrupt officials.
sentences.chinese: 農民起義反對貪官污吏。

definition: internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
to transition to a new dynasty or regime
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
Hunan army, irregular force formed in 1850s to fight the Taiping heavenly kingdom rebellion
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
